result.title: Dynamic maximum length of continuous subsegment
result.content:
Hello I'm posting here because I have been thinking about his problem for a very long time, yet I can't find a solution. I am hoping you could help find it.

Unfortunately I have not been able to find it in English, however the core is:

Your are given a sequence of N (1 < N < 1000000) bits and are asked to perform Q (1 < Q < 1000000) operations. Operations of type 1 ("1 n") which indicates that bit number n has been flipped; and of type 2 ("2") which you should answer with the length of the largest contiguous subsegment of zeroes.

Input:

N Q (the N bits)

(Q lines with the querys)

Ex:

10 5

1001011010

1 4

2

1 3

2

1 3

I have thought of several solutions however the best complexity I can think of is O((N+Q)logN) with fenwick trees which is too slow given the order of magnitude of both N and Q. What do you think, how could the complexity be lowered? I would really appreciate any help, thanks in advance.
